I-73 will help mitigate the life-threatening impacts of future disasters and provide the lifeline we needed during Hurricane Florence.

Hurricane Florence highlighted the need for an adequate evacuation route for the Grand Strand and I'm fighting for it! The storm put 250,000 of my constituents at risk of being completely isolated from the rest of the state with no access to food, water, or medical supplies.

Part of living in the beautiful state of South Carolina is preparing for natural disasters and part of our responsibility as government officials is ensuring we are doing everything possible to improve future disaster mitigation and response efforts. pic.twitter.com/URyJllxLrd
